pageContext.claim: “He looked at the sheet -- which was an exact transcript of my call, done by very talented people that do this -- exact, word for word....I had a transcript done by very, very talented people -- word for word, comma for comma. Done by people that do it for a living. We had an exact transcript.”
pageContext.analysis: It was not an exact transcript. The memo released by the White House includes a “caution” note saying it “is not a verbatim transcript.” Current and former U.S. officials studying the document pointed to several elements that, they say, indicate that the document may have been handled in an unusual way, the Washington Post reported. Those include the use of ellipses — punctuation indicating that information has been deleted for clarity or other reasons — that traditionally have not appeared in summaries of presidential calls with foreign leaders.
